etymology.description: 𠫓 ‘newborn’ + 儿 ‘standing person’ — a newborn grows to stand and become mature.
etymology.interpretation: Shows the progression from infancy to standing adulthood, evoking the idea of becoming complete or fully developed. This metaphor extends to senses like “to fill/be full” and, by extension, “to serve or act as” in a role.

examples.chinese: 手机没电了(手機沒電了)，我去充电(我去充電)。
examples.pinyin: Shǒujī méi diàn le, wǒ qù chōngdiàn.
examples.english: My phone is out of battery; I’m going to charge it.

examples.chinese: 气球里充满了空气(氣球裡充滿了空氣)。
examples.english: The balloon is filled with air.

examples.chinese: 他今天充当向导(他今天充當嚮導)。
examples.english: Today he acts as a guide.
